content.question:
Step 1: 

<math alttext="H C O O H plus H 2 S O 4 produces H C O O H 2 with a positive 1 charge plus H S O 4 with a negative 1 charge " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCOOH</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HCOOH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HSO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> 

Step 2: 

<math alttext="H C O O H 2 with a positive 1 charge produces H C O with a positive 1 charge plus H 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HCOOH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>HCO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 

Step 3: 

<math alttext="H C O with a positive 1 charge plus H S O 4 with a negative 1 charge produces C O plus H 2 S O 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>HCO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HSO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>CO</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> 

The elementary steps in a proposed mechanism for the decomposition of <math alttext="H C O O H " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCOOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are represented above. Which of the following identifies the catalyst in the overall reaction and correctly justifies the choice?

choices.label: <math alttext="H 2 S O 4 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it is consumed in the first step of the mechanism and regenerated in a later step.

<math alttext="H C O O H " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCOOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because increasing the concentration of <math alttext="H C O O H " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCOOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> increases the reaction rate.

<math alttext="H C O O H 2 with a positive 1 charge " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HCOOH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it is produced in the first step of the mechanism and consumed in a later step.
<math alttext="C O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it is produced in the final step of the reaction mechanism.

content.answer: <math alttext="H 2 S O 4 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because it is consumed in the first step of the mechanism and regenerated in a later step.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
